channel.title: [READ ME] Help-topic issues
channel.description:
This topic isn't about getting help (well, not directly anyways). I'm tired of coming to this section to help kids and see this: Help Please NEED HELP 317! CAN'T LOGIN WHAT DO I DO Need Pro Coder to fix How do I change this Can't log in
Etc.
You guys. If you want some help, seriously make better topics. Ex:
[317] Changing Yell titles - PI [718] Players login with bad usernames - NameOfSource [508] How do I change the IP
ETC.
We can only help you by the information you provide us. There are thousands of private servers, and more being released every day, probably one being release as I type this and you read it. Give us all the information you can. Make an informative topic title. You also want main post to give the most information possible:
Revision: 317, 377, 474, 508, 525, 562, 667, 718, 742 or what ever. Base: Matrix, PI, Allstar, Hyperion, Delta, Rune-Source, etc. Description of error: While I was editing this thing it gave me this error below. Can someone explain what this error is and some tip on how to fix it? [code=java] if(codeTag.startsWith("[code") && codeTag.endsWith("=java]"){ system.println("You've made a java code tag! Good work); } [/code] [Obviously that wasn't an error ;) ] Pictures of the error: I don't have a real error, so: [img]http://thedailycatblog.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/01/kitties-in-teacup1.jpg[/img] MAKE SURE TO USE IMAGE BRACKETS!
Other information: This is where you'd tell us what files you were editing and anything relevant to the error.
-Thank you for reading, and I'll gladly accept my infraction, because I know I'm getting one-
-I've gone and changed the name of the thread because it's more of a discussion and such

item.title: [READ ME] Help-topic issues
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Vain_:

it’s not much effort in the sense of a community; but the people that do help, do it a lot.

Like I said, I do what I can. I’m not good with high revisions as I didn’t care to touch em, so I can’t help much anymore.

Read full topic

item.title: [READ ME] Help-topic issues
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Arcik, post:32, topic:519498”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=637962.msg4300082#msg4300082 date=1368844311]
-Thank you for reading, and I’ll gladly accept my infraction, because I know I’m getting one-
[/quote]
lolol

“i’ve never done anything complicated like this but i’m using a switch statement!!”[/quote]

I’ve never said that, and if I did it was making fun of a person in a sarcastic way.

Most help threads have usually been answered anyway.
Most took longer than need too.
But seriously why did you make this thread? I'm pretty sure you're the 1 who said this
Because I sit in this section for ~4 hours reading threads and attempting to help, most I ignore because they are either a higher revision than I use, or I can't tell what they are using. I do what I can..

Read full topic

so we know you’re not the best person at Java

item.title: [READ ME] Help-topic issues
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

because 99% of the help section doesn’t follow the rules (including this topic, because it’s nothing to do with server help but rather the section itself, would be more accepted in general discussion)

the staff list is slim compared to the userbase we have. they cannot go around infracting/warning everyone.

you’re expecting too much from the staff, and they cannot do it. adding more staff won’t help, setting up new rules won’t help.

the people on this site will never follow rules

Read full topic

item.title: [READ ME] Help-topic issues
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Edit: Seeing as most of you think this is a joke, warnings will now be handed out if you disobey this.
I don't see it happening.. Ever.

item.title: [READ ME] Help-topic issues
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:28, topic:519498”]We can still put forward some form of effort. By helping others learn how to post a better topic, even if they don’t understand the issue… They can still post better.[/quote]this is already set up in the rules.

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

nobody reads the rules anymore, and that’s their fault. we cannot change everyone in the world.

people come here for help, post a topic, then leave. this community isn’t as strong as it once was.

Read full topic

item.title: [READ ME] Help-topic issues
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:25, topic:519498”]I understand that we can’t make a change happen over night. But by sitting here, not taking any action, we aren’t stopping the issue. I would hope the admins knew that this section is the most active (well, for server related) and it needs more sectional mods than norm. Or like you said, give the server helper’s some mod powers, like locking, moving and editing. Or at least just editing. So they could at least fix a post to make it look better for others to read and help.[/quote]the change hasn’t happened when suggested in the past from more well known community members, it won’t happen now.

the fact of the matter is, server help section isn’t fully ‘active’ it just has a massive amount of posts that don’t belong in this section, and a prune would make our community look even more dead than we are.

we can’t solve the problem by simply giving more people power. staff can only do so much. the problem that we face is with ourselves, and until then, this will always be a problem.

Read full topic

item.title: [READ ME] Help-topic issues
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:1, topic:519498”] if(codeTag.startsWith("[code") && codeTag.endsWith("=java]"){ system.println("You've made a java code tag! Good work); } [/quote]

change to

if (codeTag.startsWith("[code") && codeTag.endsWith("=java]") { System.out.println("You've made a java code tag! Good work); }

make sure you have codeTag declared as a string also

Fixed your problem

/thread close ;D

Read full topic

item.title: [READ ME] Help-topic issues
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Vain_, post:24, topic:519498”][quote author=3lv3n snip3r link=topic=637962.msg4300152#msg4300152 date=1368850964]

lol @ thinking the server help badge is useful

It was a suggestion and your ‘loling’ is not helping the cause. So please, give us your input…
[/quote]i was the first person on these forums to ever receive a badge other than staff members, and my badge happened to be a server helper one.

now, as many people have tried in the past, the community sought after allowing the server helpers to have some type of moderation amongst this board, but never to any avail.

the server help section is flooded with topics of any category, purely because it is more ‘active.’ just because we set new guidelines, doesn’t mean anyone will follow them.

you can’t look at one section, and say “oh this is because of the rules are old and bad” no, not at all.
the rules here have worked for years, and still work.

sometimes, the staff don’t have enough time to go through sections and look for posts themselves, that’s why they only bother to look at reported topics.
even then, they don’t have time to read through every post to see why it doesn’t belong (so instead of people posting “wrong section” just report it and leave it be.)

you want to make a change in this section? go report every topic that breaks any of the sectional rules. and don’t post ‘wrong section’ on anything, because it is considered spam.[/quote]

Thus why I said:

sk8rdude461:

Before we waste time setting up guidelines, we’d need to get a bit of community support, or at least a moderator to support our efforts.

I understand that we can’t make a change happen over night. But by sitting here, not taking any action, we aren’t stopping the issue. I would hope the admins knew that this section is the most active (well, for server related) and it needs more sectional mods than norm. Or like you said, give the server helper’s some mod powers, like locking, moving and editing. Or at least just editing. So they could at least fix a post to make it look better for others to read and help.

Read full topic

the server help section is flooded with topics of any category, purely because it is more ‘active.’ just because we set new guidelines, doesn’t mean anyone will follow them.

you can’t look at one section, and say “oh this is because of the rules are old and bad” no, not at all.
the rules here have worked for years, and still work.

sometimes, the staff don’t have enough time to go through sections and look for posts themselves, that’s why they only bother to look at reported topics.
even then, they don’t have time to read through every post to see why it doesn’t belong (so instead of people posting “wrong section” just report it and leave it be.)

you want to make a change in this section? go report every topic that breaks any of the sectional rules. and don’t post ‘wrong section’ on anything, because it is considered spam.

item.title: [READ ME] Help-topic issues
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

Vain_:

lol @ thinking the server help badge is useful

It is purely cosmetic. I could also argue that the java guru badge is not useful. They are simply the fruits of one’s labour (which in this situation would be the obvious amount of time invested into assisting others).

Read full topic

item.title: [READ ME] Help-topic issues
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

3lv3n snip3r:

The people with the badges know what they’re talking about in whatever badge they have. Generally, most people with the ‘Senior Member’ or ‘Moparian’ rank know stuff about either Java, C#, web development, python, etc., but the ones with the badges generally know a little bit more to get that badge. Meaning, they could most likely give a little bit more info in the persons problem. Although, any help is great. And most people with any badge don’t usually post in this section much.

I’m still not entirely sure what you meant when you said making use of that badge. If you want to make a name for yourself by helping, then put a large majority of your time into the assistance side of the forums and actually help (that wasn’t directed at you, just a generalization).

And most people with any badge don't usually post in this section much.
Please refer to every comment I've made thus far.

Read full topic

item.title: [READ ME] Help-topic issues
item.dc:creator: @3lv3n_snip3r 3lv3n snip3r

item.title: [READ ME] Help-topic issues
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

Without a base to provide input on, having a moderator’s support is out of the question unless there is some moderator strolling about that does not agree with or has an issue with the current, functional guidelines. (which would be quite redundant simply because he/she could easily contact other staff and hold a meeting to discuss change(s), because they can then edit the thread themselves)
Community support can easily be gathered by the input of members within this thread. If you would take time to rearrange this thread layout in order to provoke a discussion in different areas, or at least add a poll providing options on whether or not you support the current rules/guidelines, then it would be all that much easier for you to gain some form of support.
I can tell you, though, that as long as an administrator or moderator would agree with presented ideas/concepts, then there is a possibility that it can go through to a staff meeting without community support.[quote=“3lv3n snip3r, post:15, topic:519498”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=637962.msg4300126#msg4300126 date=1368848641]
Before we waste time setting up guidelines, we’d need to get a bit of community support, or at least a moderator to support our efforts.
[/quote]
More server helpers could benefit it. I mean with like the actual badge. Or at least server help section moderator(s).[/quote]
-Elaborate more on what you mean with the badge, please? Do you mean that the badge should be actually awarded again?
-Server help moderators are around to keep order, not necessarily help.

Read full topic

item.title: [READ ME] Help-topic issues
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

3lv3n snip3r:

What people should do is what I did when I started learning html/css. A couple of months ago, I started programming with html/css. Of course, I didn’t know much about either of the languages, but I didn’t post hundreds of threads on how to do things. I searched it up and studied it. Yea, my codes weren’t the best at the start, but they progressively got better and look at me now, I have made a few decently appealing simple web templates.

But you had the patience, and the motivation. The problem being is that this section is littered with those members who only have half of the motivation spectrum, but none of the patience spectrum.

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:10, topic:519498”]This…
Right here.
This is what I’m talking about.
The end user (the person seeking help) loses our because they can’t seem to make an informative post and people like Elven and myself are too lazy to decrypt a thread to fix a 2 minute issue.
If the section rules were to entail better guidelines on making a post, and yes, there needs to be guidelines, then sectional moderators could get to work on making this section a little better.[/quote]
I’d be more than willing to create a new set of guidelines with you and have a fun little discussion.
What you must understand, though, is that there is no real problem with the current rules and guidelines - it’s how they are enforced.

Read full topic
